args.natural_language_statement: Suppose \sum_{n=1}^\infty x_n is a series whose sequence of partial sums is bounded, and {\lambda_n} is a sequence with \lim_{n\to\infty} \lambda_n = 0 and \sum_{n=1}^\infty |\lambda_{n+1}-\lambda_n| convergent. Show that \sum_{n=1}^\infty \lambda_n x_n converges. Translate to Lean4 using Mathlib and end the statement with := by sorry.

import Mathlib

open Metric Filter

/-- Dirichlet-type test: if the partial sums of `x : â„• â†’ E` are uniformly bounded, and
`Î» : â„• â†’ â„` tends to 0 and has bounded variation (i.e. `âˆ‘ |Î»_{n+1}-Î»_n|` is summable),
then the series `âˆ‘ Î»_n â€¢ x_n` is summable. -/
theorem dirichlet_bounded_variation {E : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace â„ E]
  [CompleteSpace E]
  {x : â„• â†’ E} {Î» : â„• â†’ â„}
  (hBound : âˆƒ M, âˆ€ N, â€–âˆ‘ i in Finset.range N, x iâ€– â‰¤ M)
  (hÎ»0 : Tendsto Î» atTop (ð“ 0))
  (hvar : Summable (fun n => |Î» (n+1) - Î» n|)) :
  Summable (fun n => Î» n â€¢ x n) := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- Dirichlet-type test: if the partial sums of `x : â„• â†’ E` are uniformly bounded, and
`Î» : â„• â†’ â„` tends to 0 and has bounded variation (i.e. `âˆ‘ |Î» (n+1)-Î» n|` is summable),
then the series `âˆ‘ Î»_n â€¢ x_n` is summable. -/
theorem dirichlet_bounded_variation {E : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace â„ E]
  {x : â„• â†’ E} {Î» : â„• â†’ â„}

import Mathlib

/-- Dirichlet-type test: if the partial sums of `x : â„• â†’ E` are uniformly bounded, and
`lambda : â„• â†’ â„` tends to 0 and has bounded variation (i.e. `âˆ‘ |lambda (n+1)-lambda n|` is summable),
then the series `âˆ‘ lambda_n â€¢ x_n` is summable. -/
theorem dirichlet_bounded_variation {E : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E]
  {x : â„• â†’ E} {lambda : â„• â†’ â„}
  (hBound : âˆƒ M, âˆ€ N, â€–âˆ‘ i in Finset.range (N+1), x iâ€– â‰¤ M)
  (hÎ»0 : Tendsto lambda atTop (ð“ 0))
  (hvar : Summable (fun n => |lambda (n+1) - lambda n|)) :
  Summable (fun n => lambda n â€¢ x n) := by sorry

import Mathlib

open BigOperators Finset Metric Filter

/-- Dirichlet-type test: if the partial sums of `x : â„• â†’ E` are uniformly bounded, and
`a : â„• â†’ â„` tends to 0 and has bounded variation (i.e. `âˆ‘ |a (n+1)-a n|` is summable),
then the series `âˆ‘ a_n â€¢ x_n` is summable. -/
theorem dirichlet_bounded_variation {E : Type*} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedSpace â„ E]
  {x : â„• â†’ E} {a : â„• â†’ â„}
  (hBound : âˆƒ M, âˆ€ N, â€–âˆ‘ i in range (N+1), x iâ€– â‰¤ M)
  (hlim : Tendsto a atTop (ð“ 0))
  (hvar : Summable (fun n => |a (n+1) - a n|)) :
  Summable (fun n => a n â€¢ x n) := by sorry

import Mathlib

theorem dirichlet_bounded_variation {E : Type _} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [SMul â„ E]
  {x : â„• â†’ E} {a : â„• â†’ â„}
  (hBound : âˆƒ M : â„, âˆ€ N, â€–âˆ‘ i in Finset.range (N+1), x iâ€– â‰¤ M)
  (h_lim : Tendsto a atTop (ð“ 0))
  (hvar : Summable (fun n => |a (n+1) - a n|)) :
  Summable (fun n => a n â€¢ x n) := by
